      • home

        public void home(ReferenceMachine machine)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Perform the hardware homing operation. When this completes the axes should be at their homing location. The call might return before this physically happens, so a waitForCompletion() is needed if you need to be sure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setGlobalOffsets

        public void setGlobalOffsets(ReferenceMachine machine,
                             AxesLocation location)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Set the current physical axis positions to be reinterpreted as the specified coordinates. Used after visual homing and to reset a rotation angle after it has wrapped around. In G-Code parlance this is setting a global offset:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        http://www.linuxcnc.org/docs/html/gcode/coordinates.html#_the_g92_commands, http://smoothieware.org/g92-cnc, https://github.com/synthetos/TinyG/wiki/Coordinate-Systems#offsets-to-the-offsets-g92

      • getReportedLocation

        public AxesLocation getReportedLocation(long timeout)

        Get the momentary real-time location from the controller. This might be in mid-motion.
        Parameters:
        timeout - TODO

        Throws:

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(ReferenceHeadMountable hm,
                   Motion.MoveToCommand move)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Executes the given Motion.
        Parameters:
        hm - The HeadMountable having triggered the move. This is mostly for proprietary machine driver support and might only be a stand-in in some motion blending scenarios.
        move - The moveTo Motion to execute, including target location and limits for feedrate, acceleration etc. as shaped by the MotionPlanner
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isMotionPending

        public boolean isMotionPending()
        Returns:
        true if a motion is still assumed to be pending, i.e. waitForCompletion() has not yet been called.

      • waitForCompletion

        public void waitForCompletion(ReferenceHeadMountable hm,
                              MotionPlanner.CompletionType completionType)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Perform a coordinated wait for completion. This must be issued before capturing camera frames etc.
        Parameters:
        hm - The HeadMountable to wait for. If null, wait for all the axes on the driver. Most drivers/controllers will probably not be able to wait for just a sub-set of axes, so the'll wait for all the axes anyway.
        completionType - The kind of completion wanted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        @Deprecated
public void migrateDriver(Machine machine)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: AbstractDriver
        Migrates the driver for the new global axes implementation. Is marked a deprecated as it can be removed along with the old GcodeDriver Axes implementation, once migration of users is expected to be complete.
